summary: The "Close the Round-Tripping Loophole Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to address tax avoidance strategies involving "round-tripping" income. It modifies how global intangible low-taxed income (GILTI) is calculated to exclude income derived from transactions that appear to funnel money back into the US to avoid taxes. The bill also includes provisions for small businesses and sets effective dates for the changes.
